wrapper_tool.name: create_worker_time_block

description.tagline: Creates a worker time block in Workday.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create a time block for a specified worker in the Workday system. This is useful for recording working hours, whether hourly or in certain time zones, for project-related tasks. Ensure to include necessary details like calendar date, in/out times, and select one from time entry code, project, or project plan task.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of worker time block creation.

arguments.name: workday_resource_id
arguments.description: The Workday ID of the specific worker resource to create a time block for.

arguments.name: worker_time_block_details
arguments.description: JSON object with details for creating a time block, including calendarDate, reportedQuantity, inTime, outTime, inTimeZone, outTimeZone, and one of timeEntryCode, project, or projectPlanTask.

api_endpoints.summary: Creates a worker time block.
api_endpoints.description: Creates a worker time block for the specified worker. Specify these required fields in the request body: * calendarDate and reportedQuantity - If the worker is hourly. * inTime, outTime, inTimeZone and outTimeZone - If the worker is in and out. * One of timeEntryCode, project, or projectPlanTask. These fields are mutually exclusive. Specify 1 of these fields in the request body. For the timeEntryCode id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/timeEntryCodes, which returns the time entry codes that the given worker is eligible for on the given date. For a valid project id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/projects, which you can filter by date and worker. For a valid projectPlanTask id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/projectPlanTasks, which you can filter by date, worker, and project. Secured by: Process: Time Block REST APIs Scope: Time Tracking

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

arguments.name: period_date
arguments.description: Contains the specified date to match a period. Defaults to today's date if not provided.

wrapper_tool.name: submit_time_review_event

description.tagline: Submit a time review event for a worker.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create a time review event for a specific worker. Ideal for managers or administrators to submit time on behalf of employees, or for employees to submit their own time for approval. Ensure to specify the date for the time review period. Optionally, include a comment if it's allowed by the business process.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details about the submitted time review event for a worker.

arguments.name: workday_worker_id
arguments.description: The Workday ID of the worker for whom the time review event is being created.

arguments.name: time_review_event_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing 'date' (required) and 'comment' (optional) for submitting a time review event. 'date' should follow the format YYYY-MM-DD. Include a 'comment' only if it is permitted by the business process.

api_endpoints.summary: Adds time review events for the specified worker.
api_endpoints.description: Creates a time review event for the specified worker. This endpoint is typically used by managers or administrators to submit time on behalf of workers, or by workers themselves to submit their own time for approval. Specify these required fields in the request body: * date: the date that constructs the Time Review Event. The date is used to create Time Review Events for the Period or Week, depending on how that worker's Time Entry Template is configured. Additional optional field: * comment: comment related to the business process that persists on each Time Review Event. Comments are not allowed if disabled on the Enter Time business process. To get more information about Administrator-configured critical time validations, use the GET /timeValidations operation. This operation is equivalent to the Submit Time task in the Workday UI. The same validations and business rules apply. This includes any configured approvals, notifications, and audit trails. Sample Request: ``` { "date": "2024-01-26", "comment": "Submitting time for approval." } ``` Secured by: Manager: Time Tracking Manager Approval, Manager: Time Tracking Manager Edit and Approve, Submit Time (REST Service) Scope: Time Tracking, Time Tracking Hub

path.name: ID

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

path.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

date.description: The date used to create the time review event. The date uses the format: yyyy-mm-dd. If Submit by Time Period is enabled on the worker's Time Entry Template as of the provided date, time is submitted for the pay period. Otherwise, time is submitted for the week.

timeReviewEvents.description: Contains Time Review Events created in the Submit Time request.

position.description: Contains Position for Time Review Event if Independent Events for Multiple Jobs is enabled on the Time Entry Template.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance

project.description: Contains \~Project\~ for Time Review Event if Independent Events for \~Project\~ is enabled on the Time Entry Template.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance

status.description: Contains the current status of the business process.  For example: Successfully Completed, Denied, Terminated.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance
The display name of the instance

comment.description: The comment that persists on each time review event. Comments are not allowed if comments are disabled for the Enter Time business process or for all business processes in the tenant. For more information, see Reference: Edit Tenant Setup - Business Processes in the Admin Guide.
comment.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.

api_endpoints.summary: Updates the time clock event for the specified ID.
api_endpoints.description: Updates the time clock event for the specified ID. Replaces the existing time clock event with the specified data in the request body. The timeEntryCode, project, and projectPlanTask fields are mutually exclusive. You can only specify 1 of these fields in the request body. For the timeEntryCode id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/timeEntryCodes, which returns the time entry codes that the given worker is eligible for on the given date. For a valid project id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/projects, which you can filter by date and worker. For a valid projectPlanTask id, you can use a returned id from GET /values/timeTypes/projectPlanTasks, which you can filter by date, worker, and project. Secured by: Process: Time Clock Event REST API's Scope: Time Tracking

query.name: interviewStatus

value_schema.description:
"All applicable interview statuses for an Interview event. Statuses can be: 
 * AWAITING_ME - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for the logged-in user's feedback. 
 * COMPLETED - An Interview event is complete.
 * FEEDBACK_COMPLETE - All interview feedback for this in-progress event was submitted, but the Interview event isn’t awaiting the Make Interview Decision step.
 * NOT_SCHEDULED - An interview hasn't been scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * PENDING_FEEDBACK - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for interviewer feedback.
 * SCHEDULED - An interview is scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * SUBMITTED_FEEDBACK - The logged-in user submitted feedback for an in-progress Interview event.
 * MAKE_INTERVIEW_DECISION - The make an interview decision step for the candidate."

api_endpoints.summary: Partially updates an existing payroll input instance.
api_endpoints.description: Partially updates an existing payroll input instance with the specified ID and the specified data in the request body. Before calling this PATCH method, call the GET /payrollInputs method to retrieve the current payroll input information. You cannot update the worker field with this PATCH method. The Pay Component Segment Security configuration is required. Note that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service – Worker security group type as the basis. **Starting in v2:** The fieldEditability field in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determines the fields that you can update with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. Possible fieldEditability values: * all - All fields can be updated, except the worker field. * none - No fields can be updated. * endDateOnly - Only the endDate field can be updated. ** In v1: ** The lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult fields in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determine the fields you can update with this PATCH method: * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both false, all fields can be updated, except the worker field. * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both true, no fields can be updated. * If only usedInCompletedResult is true, only the endDate field can be updated. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

wrapper_tool.name: create_company_sui_rates

description.tagline: Create company State Unemployment Insurance (SUI) rates.
description.detailed: This tool is used to create one or multiple company SUI rates for USA Payroll. It requires specifying necessary fields like companyInstance, stateInstance, taxCode, and startDate. Use for managing payroll tax filings.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of SUI rates creation or error message.

arguments.name: sui_rates_data
arguments.description: JSON formatted data for creating SUI rates. Include companyInstance, stateInstance, taxCode, startDate. For bulk creation, use a JSON array.

api_endpoints.summary: Creates a single or a collection of Company SUI Rates.
api_endpoints.description: Creates a single or a collection of company SUI rates. To create a single company SUI rate, specify the single JSON object in the request body. To create multiple company SUI rates, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: companyInstance, stateInstance, taxCode, startDate. Secured by: Process: Tax Filing/W-2s (Run) - USA Scope: USA Payroll

ein.description: The payroll tax authority EIN field for company tax reporting.

taxCode.description: The deduction for company tax reporting.

applicableRate.description: The tax override rate for company tax reporting.

endDate.description: The end date for company tax reporting.

stateInstance.description: The payroll tax authority object for company tax reporting.

companyInstance.description: The company object for company tax reporting.

exempt.description: If true, the SUI rate is exempt.

startDate.description: The start date for company tax reporting.
